column5: He was a completely selfish jerk and has no self awareness for the hypocrisy of his words or actions... why did you feel sorry for him?

Oh my gosh I know this feeling all too well. I‚Äôve been prescribed anti depressants twice and I‚Äôve been recommended to get on them yet again. I‚Äôm not against medication but once the idea gets in my head that some pill is going to make me ‚Äúbetter‚Äù I get scared. Do I actually want to get better? If I get better does that mean what I‚Äôve been through actually isn‚Äôt that bad? What keeps me from wanting to be okay? I‚Äôve been acting okay towards everyone else so they don‚Äôt notice , but if I‚Äôm not depressed or anxious... what or what am I? I‚Äôm sorry this probably doesn‚Äôt help but I really connected to what you said. Hope all will be okay

I do this every day. Especially when I talk to someone superior to me at work. I'll even remake the faces I made during the conversation to determine whether I looked stupid or not. I will physically wince and groan as if I'm in pain just thinking about the interaction and its seriously maddening. I constantly tell myself that the other person probably hasn't thought about the interaction since it happened, but it fails to make me feel better most of the time. And its not just things that happened that day, I still think of conversations/things I did over 10 years ago and can't handle the feelings I get... its like I'm literally there living through it again and feel the intense same and embarrassment
I totally relate to almost everything you wrote, for a second I thought I wrote it myself lol. I hate when people think I‚Äôm totally fine and normal just because I do a good job of hiding everything

I‚Äôm this same way but I love somewhat changing my identity through clothes. I know to other people who see me it doesn‚Äôt change anything about me, I‚Äôm still me. But in my head I can pretend that I‚Äôm someone completely different.

One of the requirements to have DID is repeated severe childhood trauma from your primary caretaker(s). If you didn‚Äôt experience that  and don‚Äôt have PTSD you don‚Äôt have DID. It develops at ages 7-9 and it‚Äôs impossible to get it later on in life.

A part of DID is the brain puts up amnesic walls between personalities, so the host or other personalities don‚Äôt have to deal with the trauma. Obviously we found this out in season 4, so I‚Äôm assuming a lot of the things his mom did to him he can‚Äôt remember. That could be why he was more willing to talk to her than Darlene was.

I‚Äôm sorry but he sounds like a dick. I was with my last FP for over a year, and on our one year anniversary I finally built the courage to tell them I loved them. They said it back, but for the rest of our time together i always had to say it first. I noticed they weren‚Äôt genuine about it and seemed somewhat uncomfortable. It ended up being one of the reasons we broke up. Now i realize i deserve more than to be with someone who doesn‚Äôt reciprocate my feelings. It‚Äôs not your fault. You aren‚Äôt less than anyone, you don‚Äôt deserve less. If he says he isn‚Äôt capable of love and you don‚Äôt know why, try to encourage him to open up about what could make him think that.
